intro: Crantzia strigosa, commonly known as the rough crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture, and its flowers are usually pink or purple. Crantzia strigosa is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
